responses.rationale: The segment reports confirmed cases at specific locations, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment is a headline reporting detection, not prices or economic metrics.
Reports the number of states with outbreaks ('Seventeen states have already had outbreaks').
Reports the number of birds killed ('Over 15.6 million chickens and 1.3 million turkeys were killed').
Reports the number of outbreaks and affected flocks ('nine outbreaks, affecting seven commercial flocks and two backyard flocks').
Includes a warning that the situation 'could worsen', which is not factual reporting of current metrics.
Reports new cases and spread to states ('spread to more than 30 states').
The segment reports the predominant strain, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports a positive test, not prices or economic metrics.
Reports the number of commercial farms and backyard flocks affected ('found in 48 commercial farms... and 32 backyard flocks').
The segment reports on risk levels, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports on trial results, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports on company actions regarding contracts, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports a statement about signing/committing, not prices or economic metrics.
Reports the number of condors that have died and tested positive ('Twenty California condors... have died', 'half... tested positive').
Reports biological metrics (years to mature, young per year) and impact ('taking up to eight years', 'one young every other year').
Uses the framing language 'tremendous impact' and 'likely to take decades'.
The segment reports on migration patterns aiding spread, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports on historical patterns and spread duration, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports detection in a child, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports a positive test in a child, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports detection at a farm after deaths, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports on the variant detected and previous detections, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports on the commonality of a virus type, not prices or economic metrics.
Uses the framing language 'causing great concern' and 'behaved unusually'.
The segment contains a quote expressing a sentiment ('never say it's a relief'), not factual metric reporting.
Reports the number of species spread to and widespread presence ('spread to more than 40 species').
Uses the framing language 'enormous concern' and reports on risk levels.

The segment is a question, not factual reporting of metrics.

Reports the number of birds that died by specific dates ('By Feb. 17, 16 laying hens had also died and by March 2, three geese, three peacocks and one duck had died').

Reports that prices 'have been rising'.
